channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Maitai River advocates 'taken by surprise' over housing development plan
item.description: Debate is heating up over plans for up to 700 homes off part of the tree-lined Maitai Valley, a few minutes east of central Nelson.

item.title: Flight with latest Covid-19 case 'crammed': 'We had people right up against us'
item.description: A woman who was on the same flight as New Zealand's latest confirmed case of Covid-19 says there was no social distancing on board and many people weren't wearing masks.

item.title: New gun laws a win for campaigners, despite years to wait
item.description: A gun register may be delayed for three years, but Gun Control New Zealand is still claiming it as a victory.

item.title: No tsunami threat after 7.4 magnitude quake strikes
item.description: A magnitude 7.4 earthquake has struck 700km off New Zealand's northeastern coast.

item.title: South Island likely to be hardest hit in Covid-19 recession - Westpac report
item.description: A new economic forecast predicts the South Island regions will be the worst affected by a severe recession, while Wellington and Auckland have the best prospects for recovery.

item.title: World Albatross Day: How NZ became the world's albatross capital
item.description: The Otago Peninsula is home to the world's only mainland royal albatross breeding colony, but it is hard to believe the colony's existence is not only relatively recent but the product of the threat of war.

item.title: Slips, surface flooding on Wellington roads after two days of rain
item.description: A second day of heavy rain has caused more landslips and surface flooding in Wellington.

item.title: Benefit application denials based on relationship status skyrocket
item.description: The number of people being refused benefits because of their relationship status jumped to 414 during April - having been less than 80 for the three months prior.

item.title: Ministry of Health confirms masks to be compulsory on trans-Tasman flights
item.description: The vexed question of whether to wear a mask or not wear a mask may now come to a close - at least for those on trans-Tasman flights.

item.title: Queenstown residents 'exhausted, afraid and losing hope'
item.description: Queenstown social services are calling for government support, saying they're buckling under mounting pressure.

item.title: Auckland on the cusp of emergency water crisis
item.description: Auckland is on the cusp of an emergency water crisis as it stares down the barrel of the region's worst drought in 25 years.

item.title: Pilots protest as government shoots down laser pointer penalty bill
item.description: Pilots are angry at the government for voting against a bill which would have increased penalties for people that shine laser pointers at aircraft.

item.title: One new case of Covid-19 in NZ as new arrival in quarantine tests positive
item.description: New Zealand has one new case of Covid-19 after a man in his 60s in quarantine after arriving from Pakistan tested positive.

item.title: Plumber tells hearing shoddy work was not his fault
item.description: A plumber defending charges over defective drains at a retirement village says something went wrong at the project but it was not his or his workers' fault.

item.title: Drugs, cars, and bikes seized in raid targeting Hells Angels
item.description: Police have arrested and charged 13 people after an operation targetting the Hells Angels gang.

item.title: 'I've taken responsibility to make sure that the system is sorted' - Bloomfield
item.description: Director-General of Health Dr Ashley Bloomfield has apologised after saying the two new cases on Tuesday will have upset people and shaken people's confidence.

item.title: Despite set-back, tourism industry body still wants Aus-NZ border open by September
item.description: The tourism industry wants more clarity on a trans-Tasman bubble after receiving a potential set-back from the Australian Government.

item.title: Firearm legislation passes final reading
item.description: The government has pushed through its second tranche of firearms changes promised in the wake of last year's Christchurch shootings.
